title: Donald Trump picks lawyer Alina Habba as counsellor to US president
content: Donald Trump has appointed Alina Habba, his former defense attorney, as counselor to the president. Trump lauded Habba's loyalty amidst his legal battles, including the recent hush-money case conviction. He also announced State Department appointments for Michael Anton as director of policy planning and Michael Needham as counselor.
summary: Donald Trump has appointed Alina Habba, his former defense attorney, as counselor to the president.  Trump lauded Habba's loyalty amidst his legal battles, including the recent hush-money case conviction.  He also announced State Department appointments for Michael Anton as director of policy planning and Michael Needham as counselor.

title: Watch: Syrian rebels find Ferraris, Rolls-Royces, and other luxury cars in Bashar Al-Assad's palace
content: Syrian rebels, led by Hayat Tahrir al-Sham, seized control of Bashar al-Assad's palace after he fled to Russia, ending his 13-year rule. The rebels discovered Assad's extravagant car collection, sparking online outrage. The collection included luxury brands like Ferrari, Aston Martin, and Rolls-Royce, highlighting the stark contrast between Assad's lavish lifestyle and the suffering of Syrian citizens.
summary: Syrian rebels, led by Hayat Tahrir al-Sham, seized control of Bashar al-Assad's palace after he fled to Russia, ending his 13-year rule.  The rebels discovered Assad's extravagant car collection, sparking online outrage. The collection included luxury brands like Ferrari, Aston Martin, and Rolls-Royce, highlighting the stark contrast between Assad's lavish lifestyle and the suffering of Syrian citizens.

title: 'Our tax dollars are somehow funding both sides': Elon Musk on Syrian crisis
content: Elon Musk criticized US funding of opposing sides in the Syrian conflict, highlighting a 2016 report of CIA-backed and Pentagon-backed militias clashing. Syrian rebels claimed control of Homs, celebrating Assad's reported departure to Russia after 24 years in power.
summary: Elon Musk criticized US funding of opposing sides in the Syrian conflict, highlighting a 2016 report of CIA-backed and Pentagon-backed militias clashing.  Syrian rebels claimed control of Homs, celebrating Assad's reported departure to Russia after 24 years in power.

title: 'Defund the police' advocate slammed for asking cops to locate her stolen truck
content: A San Francisco woman, Darcie Bell, known for advocating to defund the police, faced online criticism after pleading for help locating her stolen U-Haul truck containing all her possessions. Bell expressed frustration with the police response, despite filing a report as required by U-Haul. She defended her stance while critics highlighted the apparent contradiction in her actions.
summary: A San Francisco woman, Darcie Bell, known for advocating to defund the police, faced online criticism after pleading for help locating her stolen U-Haul truck containing all her possessions.  Bell expressed frustration with the police response, despite filing a report as required by U-Haul.  She defended her stance while critics highlighted the apparent contradiction in her actions.

title: As Syria’s 'human slaughterhouse' prisons empty, families search for missing inmates
content: Rebels liberated Saydnaya prison near Damascus, freeing thousands of prisoners. Families rushed to the notorious facility, searching for missing loved ones. The prison, infamous for its brutality under the Assad regime, held an estimated 20,000 prisoners, with thousands more missing across Syria. The liberation marks a significant moment in the regime's collapse.
summary: Rebels liberated Saydnaya prison near Damascus, freeing thousands of prisoners. Families rushed to the notorious facility, searching for missing loved ones.  The prison, infamous for its brutality under the Assad regime, held an estimated 20,000 prisoners, with thousands more missing across Syria.  The liberation marks a significant moment in the regime's collapse.

title: Watch: Out of jail on medical leave, Iran’s Nobel laureate Narges Mohammadi sings 'Bella Ciao' on video call
content: Nobel Peace Prize laureate Narges Mohammadi, currently imprisoned in Iran, connected with the Nobel Committee via video call from prison. Granted temporary release for medical treatment, she joyfully recounted hearing the news of her award amidst chants of 'Azadi' (freedom) from fellow inmates.
summary: Nobel Peace Prize laureate Narges Mohammadi, currently imprisoned in Iran, connected with the Nobel Committee via video call from prison. Granted temporary release for medical treatment, she joyfully recounted hearing the news of her award amidst chants of 'Azadi' (freedom) from fellow inmates.

title: 'We think we can get him back': Biden, Austin Tice's family hopes alive after journalist disappears in Syria
content: President Biden and the family of Austin Tice, an American journalist missing in Syria since 2012, expressed renewed hope for his return. While lacking definitive proof of his location, Biden believes Tice is alive. The US government, through various channels, has been working to secure his release, though the Syrian government previously denied holding him.
summary: President Biden and the family of Austin Tice, an American journalist missing in Syria since 2012, expressed renewed hope for his return. While lacking definitive proof of his location, Biden believes Tice is alive. The US government, through various channels, has been working to secure his release, though the Syrian government previously denied holding him.

title: Why Sydney Thomas broke up with her boyfriend before Jake Paul vs Mike Tyson fight
content: "[I] had no problems with him at all. He was great,” Thomas explained. “I just broke up with him because I was like, ‘I need and want more time with myself.’” She went on to share her desire to focus on self-discovery, saying, “I wanted to take the time to discover who I am and just be alone.”
summary: "[I] had no problems with him at all. He was great,” Thomas explained. “I just broke up with him because I was like, ‘I need and want more time with myself.’” She went on to share her desire to focus on self-discovery, saying, “I wanted to take the time to discover who I am and just be alone.”

title: NYPD releases new photos of suspected killer of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson
content: The NYPD released new images of the suspect in the Wednesday shooting death of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson. One shows him in a taxi after the incident. The suspect, wearing a mask and dark clothing, took a cab from the Upper West Side to a bus station near the George Washington Bridge.
summary: The NYPD released new images of the suspect in the Wednesday shooting death of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson. One shows him in a taxi after the incident. The suspect, wearing a mask and dark clothing, took a cab from the Upper West Side to a bus station near the George Washington Bridge.

title: 'He’s a good looking guy': What Trump said after meeting Prince William in Paris
content: President-elect Trump and Prince William met in Paris, discussing various topics, including William's family. Trump praised William's appearance and demeanor. The conversation also touched upon the health challenges faced by King Charles III and Kate Middleton, who recently completed chemotherapy for cancer.
summary: President-elect Trump and Prince William met in Paris, discussing various topics, including William's family. Trump praised William's appearance and demeanor.  The conversation also touched upon the health challenges faced by King Charles III and Kate Middleton, who recently completed chemotherapy for cancer.

title: Inside Syria's 'human slaughterhouse': Rebels detail the atrocities of infamous Saydnaya prison
content: Syrian rebels liberated Saydnaya Prison, a notorious detention center near Damascus, revealing horrific conditions and atrocities committed under Assad's regime. Thousands of prisoners, including children, endured torture, starvation, and neglect. Emotional reunions followed as families embraced freed loved ones after years of separation. The liberation symbolized the end of Assad's oppressive rule.
summary: Syrian rebels liberated Saydnaya Prison, a notorious detention center near Damascus, revealing horrific conditions and atrocities committed under Assad's regime.  Thousands of prisoners, including children, endured torture, starvation, and neglect.  Emotional reunions followed as families embraced freed loved ones after years of separation. The liberation symbolized the end of Assad's oppressive rule.

title: US President-elect Donald Trump picks former ambassador to Mexico Christopher Landau for deputy secretary of state
content: President-elect Donald Trump has nominated Christopher Landau as Deputy Secretary of State. Landau, a former ambassador to Mexico and experienced lawyer, will collaborate with Secretary of State nominee Marco Rubio on implementing an "America First" foreign policy focused on border security, economic growth, and strategic military alliances.
summary: President-elect Donald Trump has nominated Christopher Landau as Deputy Secretary of State. Landau, a former ambassador to Mexico and experienced lawyer, will collaborate with Secretary of State nominee Marco Rubio on implementing an "America First" foreign policy focused on border security, economic growth, and strategic military alliances.

title: 'Fundamental act of justice': World leaders react to fall of Bashar Al-Assad's regime in Syria
content: Rebel forces swiftly overthrew Bashar al-Assad's regime in Syria, prompting varied global reactions. World leaders addressed the implications of Assad's fall, emphasizing peace, stability, and the need for a Syrian-led transition. While some celebrated the end of Assad's rule, others expressed caution and called for political dialogue.
summary: Rebel forces swiftly overthrew Bashar al-Assad's regime in Syria, prompting varied global reactions.  World leaders addressed the implications of Assad's fall, emphasizing peace, stability, and the need for a Syrian-led transition.  While some celebrated the end of Assad's rule, others expressed caution and called for political dialogue.

title: 'Expect our relations with India to be based on fairness': Bangladesh ahead of FS Misri's visit
content: Indian Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri's upcoming visit to Bangladesh aims to mend strained relations following a recent political upheaval. Bangladesh seeks improved ties based on "fairness" while also pursuing the extradition of former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina, currently sheltered in India. Key bilateral issues, including border management and trade, will be on the agenda.
summary: Indian Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri's upcoming visit to Bangladesh aims to mend strained relations following a recent political upheaval.  Bangladesh seeks improved ties based on "fairness" while also pursuing the extradition of former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina, currently sheltered in India.  Key bilateral issues, including border management and trade, will be on the agenda.

title: South Korean police mull travel ban on President Yoon amid probe over martial law
'Much heavier': King Charles reveals how he felt about his coronation crown
content: King Charles III, in a new documentary, expressed his anxiety about wearing the heavy St. Edward's Crown, fearing it might wobble. He recalled his mother, Queen Elizabeth II, practicing with the crown during his childhood bath times. The documentary, "Coronation Girls," features twelve Canadian women who attended Elizabeth's 1953 coronation and revisited Buckingham Palace in 2023, unexpectedly meeting the King.
summary: King Charles III, in a new documentary, expressed his anxiety about wearing the heavy St. Edward's Crown, fearing it might wobble. He recalled his mother, Queen Elizabeth II, practicing with the crown during his childhood bath times. The documentary, "Coronation Girls," features twelve Canadian women who attended Elizabeth's 1953 coronation and revisited Buckingham Palace in 2023, unexpectedly meeting the King.

title: Passenger attempts to divert Mexican flight to US by force
content: A passenger on a Volaris flight to Tijuana attempted to forcibly divert the plane to the US on Sunday, claiming death threats. The crew successfully detained the man, diverting the flight to Guadalajara, where authorities apprehended him. All other passengers continued safely to Tijuana. Volaris CEO praised the crew's bravery and the airline plans legal action.
summary: A passenger on a Volaris flight to Tijuana attempted to forcibly divert the plane to the US on Sunday, claiming death threats. The crew successfully detained the man, diverting the flight to Guadalajara, where authorities apprehended him.  All other passengers continued safely to Tijuana. Volaris CEO praised the crew's bravery and the airline plans legal action.

title: 'If US is subsidising Canada and Mexico then let them become states,' Trump suggests
content: President-elect Trump suggested Canada and Mexico consider becoming US states if they continue receiving substantial US subsidies. He threatened to impose 25% tariffs if they don't control illegal immigration, citing the subsidies as justification for this measure. Trump defended tariffs as beneficial and revenue-generating, highlighting his administration's economic successes.
summary: President-elect Trump suggested Canada and Mexico consider becoming US states if they continue receiving substantial US subsidies. He threatened to impose 25% tariffs if they don't control illegal immigration, citing the subsidies as justification for this measure. Trump defended tariffs as beneficial and revenue-generating, highlighting his administration's economic successes.

title: Can US President-elect Donald Trump eliminate birthright citizenship? Legal experts answer
content: Donald Trump pledged to end birthright citizenship in a potential second term, despite legal hurdles. He stated his intent on NBC's "Meet the Press", suggesting public consultation on navigating the 14th Amendment. Experts, however, maintain that altering birthright citizenship requires a constitutional amendment, a complex process demanding substantial congressional and state support.
summary: Donald Trump pledged to end birthright citizenship in a potential second term, despite legal hurdles.  He stated his intent on NBC's "Meet the Press", suggesting public consultation on navigating the 14th Amendment.  Experts, however, maintain that altering birthright citizenship requires a constitutional amendment, a complex process demanding substantial congressional and state support.

title: 'I was with her a lot': Donald Trump describes Italy PM Giorgia Meloni as 'real live wire' after Paris dinner
content: Former US President Donald Trump met with various world leaders in Paris, including Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni, whom he called a "real live wire." He discussed NATO finances with French President Emmanuel Macron and had a cordial exchange with First Lady Jill Biden.
summary: Former US President Donald Trump met with various world leaders in Paris, including Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni, whom he called a "real live wire." He discussed NATO finances with French President Emmanuel Macron and had a cordial exchange with First Lady Jill Biden.
